cons: Could Cause Bacterial Infection. Oysters are no exception.
Allergic Reaction, oysters contain an allergen called tropomyosin. Tropomyosin is a protein that triggers a reaction to those sensitive to it. Symptoms include itchy rashes or hives and wheezing.
Oysters contain too much zinc, eating a lot of oysters could lead to gastrointestinal problems. A reaction from too much zinc leads to vomiting, diarrhea and stomach cramps.
description: Oyster mushrooms boost the immune system.
Eaten raw or cooked, oyster mushrooms have antioxidant properties that protect cells.
Studies have also shown that they have significant anti-bacterial activity.
name: Oyster
pros: Oyster mushrooms boost the immune system.
Eaten raw or cooked, oyster mushrooms have antioxidant properties that protect cells.
Studies have also shown that they have significant anti-bacterial activity.
Oysters aren’t just low in calories, they are low in fat too.
Rich in Zinc, oysters yields more than three times the RDA of zinc. Zinc is an essential nutrient that strengthens the immune system. It also facilitates normal function of the body’s enzymes.
